column6: Simplify your system and eliminate all the functionality that you don't need.

Every entry in this administration guide consists of four section: 1) a checkbox for marking an item as done, 2) a help (?) icon that links to a help page, 3) a title that links to the configuration page and 4) a short description. In order to remove this line please click on the checkbox at the left and click on 'Action' beside the 'Mark as done' select.
You can simplify the main menu bar by setting permissions for specific user groups or completely disabling tabs.

You can simplify the 'Home' page by disabling portlets that you don't need. Keep the Home page in one browser windows, while enabling/disabling portlets in a second browser page. Press the browser 'Reload' button or F5 in order
You can simplify the 'Project' page by disabling portlets that you don't need.
You can simplify the 'Company' page by disabling portlets that you don't need.
You can simplify the 'User' page by disabling portlets that you don't need.
Please perform a backup after going through the simplification setps.
The following basic steps are required on nearly all systems.
Please modify the SystemLogo and SystemLogoLink parameters in Admin -> Parameters -> intranet-core in order to modify the system logo.
The default system comes with a number of emails set to a xxx@tigerpond.com in Admin -> Parameters. Please replace these values with your correct emails.
$po needs exchange rates in order to calculate consolidated profit & loss figures per project and in financial reports. You can load exchange rates from a $po server or define rates yourself.
Delete the 'Tigerpond' sample company including it's sample projects, users and companies.

The 'internal' company represents your own company (or department if you run $po in a corporation) in financial transactions. Please adapt the name and data of the 'internal' company to your organization, but DON'T modify the 'internal' Company Path. Otherwise you will get errors all over your financial system saying that 'Internal company is not defined'.

The 'System Administrator' account owns all important system objects and can not be deleted. However, you can edit the name and email of this account to reflect a user in your organization or yourself. Just don't lock yourself out of the system…

This user is one of the two predefined system administrators in the system. Please edit name and email to an administration user in your organization. As an alternative you can delete the user if you remove him from the ']po[ Admins' group.
You can modify the $po login page by manually editing the file /web/projop/www/index.adp or C:\project-open\servers\projop\www\index.adp. This ADP page is plain HTML, so it should be easy to modify.
Categories' define the types and states of all important $po objects. In order to disable categories please click the t=true or f=false letter in the 'En'=enabled column.
Please review the life cycle of projects from creation to retirement.
Please review which types of projects are useful for your organization. Please see the help section for a detailed description of the various project types and their add-on functionality.
Please review the life cycle of companies from creation to retirement.
Please review which types of companies are useful for your organization. Please see the help section for a detailed description of the various company types and their role in the system.

Please review other categories - there are many more category types that influence the behaviour of $po. Please take a few minutes and have a look yourself. Many (but not all) category types have a 'Context Help' function associated with them.
Dynfields allow you to extend $po with customer specific fields. You might want to contract training or consulting services for advanced configurations.
Please explore the collection of predefined examples of dynfield 'widgets' (entry fields and value range).
Please review if you need additional attributes for projects.
Please review if you need additional attributes for companies (customers and providers)
Please review if you need additional attributes for users.
Here you can define new widgets yourself. Please note that this page has been designed for system administrators.
You only need this section if you are going to use $po for invoicing and other financial operations.
Please modify the parameter 'DefaultCurrency' in order to set the system's default (EUR, USD, …) that is used across the financial system.
Materials are the key to determine the price of services billed to a customer. Here you can define your organization's services.
Please review the templates used to render invoices and other financial documents. This is important if you want to send out invoices to your customers directly from $po.
Define your department and cost center hierarchy. Please read about the 'Cost Center Code' in the help section.

$po allows you to configure permissions and processes in great detail. Please contract professional consulting or training if you are unfamiliar with the presented concepts, you can easily break the system in these pages.
Set up an integration with an Active Directory server in order to import users and user permissions.
Please review all remaining portlets in the system in order to simplify the system or to set permissions on portlets.
Allows you to define complex workflows that are executed every time you create a new object.

Please review the localization of $po - this page allows you to modify the translation of the $po user interface. For interactive localization you can click on the 'TRN' button on the administrator's bar at the very top of the page.

Please review the permissions for the REST Web-services API in order to grant external systems access to $po objects. The REST API allows for controlled access to $po resources for mobile or other external applications.
Install and update packages: This function is also available via the 'APM' menu on the Developer Support bar at the very top.
Review the columns in the 'Projects' page. You can add or modify columns, if you have basic TCL programming knowledge.
Review the columns in the 'Companies' page. You can add or modify columns, if you have basic TCL programming knowledge.
Review the columns in the 'Users' page. You can add or modify columns, if you have TCL basic programming knowledge.

Allows you to define customized action that are executed every time that you create or modify an object in $po. For example, you could create file storage folders for new projects, or set up new LDAP accounts for newly created users.
Please review the 'privileges' (i.e. transaction permissions). These permissions allow you to fine-tune permissions of different user groups.
Delegate user administration or define visibility between different user groups: This matix defines who (on the top horizontal bar) is allowed to V=view, R=read, W=write or A=admin) other users.
Please review other parameters - these parameters define the specific variants of processes in $po. There is an explanation for every parameter.
You will need to load master data (users, companies, …) into your system before users can actually start to use the system.
Import a list of projects into $po. You can use the Projects -> Export Projects CSV function in order to create sample input.
Import a list of companies into $po. You can use the Companies -> Export Commpanies CSV function in order to create sample input.
Import a list of users into $po. You can use Users -> Export Users CSV in order to create sample input. Please note that the LDAP Import below is an alternative for importing users.
